Class Game

java.lang.Object
iscteiul.ista.battleship.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGame
public class Game extends Object implements IGame
Manages the core logic of a Battleship game round. Tracks shots fired, hits, sinks, and invalid attempts.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(IFleet fleet)
      Initializes a new Game instance with the provided fleet. Resets all counters (invalid, repeated, hits, sinks) to zero.
      Parameters:
      fleet - The fleet of ships to be used in this game.

  • Method Details

    • fire

      public IShip fire(IPosition pos)
      Fires a shot at the specified position. This method handles the game logic: 1. Validates if the shot is within the board. 2. Checks if the shot is repeated. 3. Checks if the shot hit a ship. 4. Updates the status of the ship (hit/sunk).
      Specified by:
      fire in interface IGame
      Parameters:
      pos - The position to fire at.
      Returns:
      The IShip object if the shot sunk a ship, otherwise null.

    • getShots

      public List<IPosition> getShots()
      Retrieves the list of all valid shots fired so far.
      Specified by:
      getShots in interface IGame
      Returns:
      A list of positions representing valid shots.

    • getRepeatedShots

      public int getRepeatedShots()
      Gets the total number of shots fired at positions that were already hit.
      Specified by:
      getRepeatedShots in interface IGame
      Returns:
      The count of repeated shots.

    • getInvalidShots

      public int getInvalidShots()
      Gets the total number of shots fired outside the board boundaries.

      Returns:
      The count of invalid shots.

    • getRemainingShips

      public int getRemainingShips()
      Calculates the number of ships currently remaining (floating) in the fleet.
      Specified by:
      getRemainingShips in interface IGame
      Returns:
      The number of ships that have not been sunk.

    • validShot

      private boolean validShot(IPosition pos)
      Validates if a position is within the game board boundaries.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position to check.
      Returns:
      true if the position is inside the board (0 to BOARD_SIZE), false otherwise.

    • repeatedShot

      private boolean repeatedShot(IPosition pos)
      Checks if a shot has already been fired at the given position.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position to check.
      Returns:
      true if the position is already in the list of shots, false otherwise.

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard(List<IPosition> positions, Character marker)
      Prints a visual representation of the board with specific markers.
      Parameters:
      positions - The list of positions to mark on the board.
      marker - The character to use as a marker (e.g., 'X' or '#').

    • printValidShots

      public void printValidShots()
      Prints the board showing valid shots that have been fired (marked with 'X').
      Specified by:
      printValidShots in interface IGame

    • printFleet

      public void printFleet()
      Prints the board showing the positions of all ships in the fleet (marked with '#').
